intro: Hieracium kerneri, commonly known as the Kern's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Hieracium kerneri is often found in open meadows and slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
